page.title: 19RYE MEADS WEST
page.content: {SQUARE 3810 {EASTERN AREA: The eastern half of the square, because of the nature of the land, is neither cultivated nor built upon, and the open space is instead used for {RECREATIONal}purposes e.g. the lakes are used for water-sports and the meads support a karting/motor-cross track. {TRANSPORT}throughout the square is based on a complex network of small minor roads, serving the residential area. However there is also the 'Rye House Station' situated on a British Rail line running directly to London. The three waterways in the square are the River Lea (or Lee), the Lea Navigation Canal and the New River Canal.
